page.title: 16Religion 1
page.content: Truro has many religious denominations represented in it.There is a Bishop of Truro, leading an Anglican diocese, in the catholic tradition. The Church of England High Church tradition is upheld by All Saints, Highertown; and on weekdays at St Kea Church,can be seen the more emotional outpourings of the charismatic style, this has roots in the 18th Century influence of John Wesley and Billy Bray. Apart from the Cathedral, the Churches in Truro reflect national figures showing low church attendance. Only 170 people in St Kea of a population of 1250 are even on the Church Electoral Roll. In rural areas, and close communities, attendances tend to be higher. Freedom of Worship means people may choose which Church they attend, irrespective of parish boundaries. Services in the Cathedral are very well-attended.
